_program_info.program_name: Master of Engineering (MEng) in Chemical Engineering
_program_info.program_length: Full-time: 4 terms (16 months), Part-time: 8 terms (32 months)
_program_info.funding_note: Applicants to the MEng program are expected to be entirely self funded. No financial assistance will be provided from the Department of Chemical Engineering or the University of Waterloo.

level_constraints.description: No more than 2 total may be 500 level courses

departmental_constraints.description: Of the 7 electives, 4 must be CHE courses

additional_constraints.description: No more than 1 may be a reading course

grade_requirements.description: Minimum cumulative average of 70%. Minimum grade of 65% in each individual course.

course_validity.description: Only courses taken within five years prior to the completion of the MEng degree may be counted for credit towards a degree

seminar_attendance.description: Over the course of their degree program, all students must attend 12 seminars from departments and research institutions where Chemical Engineering faculty members have a membership
seminar_attendance.documentation: At Chemical Engineering seminars, attendance is documented. At other approved seminars, students must complete an attendance form and get it signed by the seminar organizer.

specified_fixed: CHE 600 - Engineering and Research Methods, Ethics, Practice, and Law (0.25 credit weight)

options: CHE 601 - Theory and Application of Transport Phenomena

elective.note: Of the 7 electives, 4 must be CHE courses. No more than 2 total may be 500 level courses. No more than 1 may be a reading course.

Chemical_Engineering_MEng.note: CHE 600 has 0.25 credit weight, plus 8 graduate courses (0.50 unit weight per course). Graduate courses are numbered as 600 or 700 series.

Biological_Engineering.description: Graduate Specialization consisting of 4 graduate (0.50 weight) level courses with a mix of compulsory and elective courses.

Entrepreneurship.note: Students must obtain approval from the Chemical Engineering Graduate Officer in order to pursue the Graduate Specialization in Entrepreneurship. Interested students will be required to submit a short proposal following matriculation describing their entrepreneurship idea and suitability to pursue it.
Entrepreneurship.description: Graduate Specialization requiring approval and proposal submission.

specified_fixed: CHE 541 - Introduction to Polymer Science and Properties
CHE 621 - Model Building and Response Surface Methodology

list: CHE 543 - Polymer Production: Polymer Reaction Engineering
CHE 641 - Fundamentals of Polymer Processing Operations

Polymer_Science_Engineering.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 compulsory courses and 2 elective courses.

specified_fixed: CHE 621 - Model Building and Response Surface Methodology

list: CHE 522 - Advanced Process Dynamics and Control

Process_Systems_Engineering.description: Graduate Specialization with 2 compulsory courses and 2 elective courses.

_specialization_info.limit: Students are limited to one Graduate Specialization designation for their MEng in Chemical Engineering degree
_specialization_info.transcript_note: A Graduate Specialization is a University credential that is recognized on the student's transcript but not on the diploma
